Talon: Talon nodded and said "It's understable that all are a little... st=
ressed. "said sadly Talon"Situation is very bad; we should better go with h=
er" Talon walked slowly towards the exit.
 To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
From:=
 magicquartz@...
Date: Sun, 28 Aug 2011 01:19:07 -0400
Subject: Re: L=
essons to be Learned.










        












OOC: This is where it =
gets interesting.  Beware, Wheelie has just rubbed Tucson's scales the wron=
g way and btw, he IS RELATED TO RATCHET.  Which explains his temper.
BIC:  =
Tucson grits his teeth to try and stop himself from making a grave mistake.=
  Wheelie was practically sending him over the edge.  He could see it wasn'=
t going to pan out with him after all.  Instead of getting angry although a=
gitation is in his voice, Tucson turns to Leo Prime and to Wheelie.
" This =
doesn't seem to be working well is it?  Sorry Wheelie but if you can not wo=
rk properly with command, I have no choice but to transfer you out of my sa=
nction.  I've tried hard to avoid that but your insolence only goes so far =
with me.  I'm sure another sanction will take you in willingly, you have at=
tributes they can use.  Leo, I trust you know someone who can use Wheelie, =
please see to the transfer if you could."
He turns to Talon.
"I'm sorry you=
 had to see this Talon.  I did try to keep my patience with him."
Straight =
Shot speaks up.  She looks at Wheelie completely upset.
" Thanks a lot Whee=
lie!  My brother was trying really hard to reach out to you and you go biti=
ng his hand off like a complete slag ball!  Thanks to you he's on thin ice =
with the Autobot Council!  Now this!?  HOW COULD YOU?!  I HAVE A GOOD MIND =
TA CARPET YOUR CHASSE WITH EVERY QUILL ON MY BODY!" 
She darts out with tea=
rs in her eyes.  Rattrap tries to follow.  He stares at Wheelie.
" HAPPY NO=
W!?  GOOD!  I CAN'T WAIT TILL YOU GET THAT TRANSFER! IF WINGS GETS BOOTED I=
T'S ON YOUR BACK BUMPER!" 
He too leaves the room as upset as Straight Shot=
.
Tucson looks back at them.
" Leo, keep Wheelie here, Talon, if you could,=
 I could use your help.  I've never had to console my sister and I could us=
e some advice."
Nightshift comes back from his meditation at the river, onl=
y to almost hit Straight Shot, while stopping short.  He knew right away wh=
at was troubling her.
" Uh oh, lemme guess, Wheelie huh?  Slag I knew that =
little bugger was trouble the moment he got here."
Straight Shot tries to c=
ompose herself.
" Yeah you called that one right.  And because of him, Tucs=
on could lose his status.  He's making my brother look like a fool and wors=
t off is,  Leo isn't doing anything about it.  Oh sure, ten ta one he's fav=
oring Wheelie, I see it, I'm not stupid.  Ooohhh!  This whole thing makes m=
e so mad I wanna jab every quill on my body into that little orange pest!"
=
Nightshift shifts into robot mode and sits down with Straight Shot as does =
Rattrap , who puts a consoling arm around her.
" Hey, I know things don't l=
ook so cool right now but I didn't hear your bro lose his temper, and I kno=
w when he does because the whole base would've heard him.  That's why he's =
be'n watched and so far so good.  He may have handled himself nicely in the=
re, from what I can tell.  And that's what the council looks for in a leade=
r. "
Rattrap grins.
" Good point, never thought of it that way.  Oh Wings a=
ctually told Leo ta transfer him outa the Ark and assign him to another tro=
op."
Nightshift nods.
" That's cool, at least he's still in the faction but=
 different sanction.  Not bad.  Not bad at all.  I would've done the same t=
hing if I was in his shoes.  Now, Straight Shot, don't worry, your bro ain'=
t go'n anywhere but where he is now.  Trust me, as long as he keeps his tem=
per in check and makes decisions for the benefit of our troops he'll be fin=
e."
He carefully puts an arm around his prickly comrade.
Perpetually on the=
 move and constantly busy. 
On Aug 27, 2011, at 10:50 PM, "adamsafran" <ada=
msafran@...> wrote:






 



    
      
      
      

> An insult=
 to his logic was definitely a test to Tucson's already short temper.  Yet =
he knew he had to keep that in check if he was to keep his position.  He tu=
rns to Wheelie with a narrowed brow.  Yet not one word is said.  He then ra=
ises it.

> 

> " Hmmmm... So that's how you see me?  If I'm not mistaken W=
heelie I believe you have just crossed the line of insubordination.  I'm gi=
ving you a chance to be part of the team but I see nothing in return on you=
r part.  Well, care to explain to me the Autobot code of honor and what hap=
pens when a soldier behaves out of line, going as far as insulting a Prime =
Officer?  You seem to be quite intelligent, go on, tell me."

> 

> Rattrap=
 and Straight Shot look to Wheelie in shock.

> 

> " Looks like a certain =
little go cart's in for some serious discipline. "

> 

> Straight Shot swa=
llows hard.

> 

> " His voice, it sounds just like Ratchet's voice when he=
 was ready ta lose it."

> 

> Rattrap watches with amusement.

> 

> " Ooo=
hhh so that's where Tucson's temper comes from.  Yep Wheelie is in big trou=
ble."

> 

> Tucson eyes Wheelie with arms folded in his chest.  His stare =
indicative of Ratchet when he was ready to lose his temper.

> 



At this =
point, Wheelie stood up, "Yes, I say you are wrong.  There's no such thing =
as a space bridge that strong.  You would simply see it from afar, with our=
 own optics the sensors abar.  You cannot remotely hide such a hting, in th=
e technology of our time or even that thing.  To do such a thing, to rip ap=
art time, is stupidly absurd, I call it this time.  So if you are going to =
say we should waste our time going after what does not exist, I say thee na=
y."



Wheelie went on, "So, stop wasting oru time for such a stupid thing,=
 or I will go out on my own and bring.  Rodimus is my friend, I won't leave=
 him alone to face his end.  If you are goin to be a boron, then I shall ca=
ll you a nimrod and boron."



Hissing, "Now, I would say you are wasting o=
ur time, on pointless things that we needn't to whine.  So I say, I think y=
ou want my friend dead today."



At the Laurel and Hardy back and forth of=
 Rattrap and Straight SHot, Wheelie just laughed, "And you bring up Ratchet=
?  Well he's dead.  MEgatron blew off his head.  And you seem to want Rodim=
us to end the same way.  So I shall now not leave my friend astray."



And=
 without a further word, Wheelie transformed to his vehicle mode, and raced=
 off!



OOC - This is how I see the character - at this point, he thinks i=
t's utter nonsense to waste time looking for a Space Bridge that there's no=
 evidence of or anything remotely suggesting, based upon Tuscon having a 'h=
unch' so he's going insubordinate and off on his own.  TO him, a Space Brid=
ge would e impossible to hdie (a la the third Transformers movie Dark of th=
e Moon), and so wasting time scanning for it is a fool's errand.  So he's g=
oing off to 'look' for Rodimus on his own, unless stopped or otherwis einte=
rfered with as he's afraid that Tuscon is purposefully stalling to prevent =
them from going after Rodimus.  He respects Leo Prime, but he's friends wit=
h Rorimus, and he has a very low regard for Tuscon, and at this point in hi=
s processor Tuscon deciding to check for something to him that has infinite=
simal chances of having been done and stall a gridwide search is abaondment=
 of his friend.  Anyways, wondrful posting and good luck!





    
     

=

> An insult to his logic was definitely a test to Tucson's al=
ready short temper.  Yet he knew he had to keep that in check if he was to =
keep his position.  He turns to Wheelie with a narrowed brow.  Yet not one =
word is said.  He then raises it.<br>
> <br>
> " Hmmmm... So that's h=
ow you see me?  If I'm not mistaken Wheelie I believe you have just crossed=
 the line of insubordination.  I'm giving you a chance to be part of the te=
am but I see nothing in return on your part.  Well, care to explain to me t=
he Autobot code of honor and what happens when a soldier behaves out of lin=
e, going as far as insulting a Prime Officer?  You seem to be quite intelli=
gent, go on, tell me."<br>
> <br>
> Rattrap and Straight Shot look to=
 Wheelie in shock.<br>
> <br>
> " Looks like a certain little go cart=
's in for some serious discipline. "<br>
> <br>
> Straight Shot swall=
ows hard.<br>
> <br>
> " His voice, it sounds just like Ratchet's voi=
ce when he was ready ta lose it."<br>
> <br>
> Rattrap watches with a=
musement.<br>
> <br>
> " Ooohhh so that's where Tucson's temper comes=
 from.  Yep Wheelie is in big trouble."<br>
> <br>
> Tucson eyes Whee=
lie with arms folded in his chest.  His stare indicative of Ratchet when he=
 was ready to lose his temper.<br>
> <br>
<br>
At this point, Wheelie st=
ood up, "Yes, I say you are wrong.  There's no such thing as a space bridge=
 that strong.  You would simply see it from afar, with our own optics the s=
ensors abar.  You cannot remotely hide such a hting, in the technology of o=
ur time or even that thing.  To do such a thing, to rip apart time, is stup=
idly absurd, I call it this time.  So if you are going to say we should was=
te our time going after what does not exist, I say thee nay."<br>
<br>
Whee=
lie went on, "So, stop wasting oru time for such a stupid thing, or I will =
go out on my own and bring.  Rodimus is my friend, I won't leave him alone =
to face his end.  If you are goin to be a boron, then I shall call you a ni=
mrod and boron."<br>
<br>
Hissing, "Now, I would say you are wasting our ti=
me, on pointless things that we needn't to whine.  So I say, I think you wa=
nt my friend dead today."<br>
<br>
At the Laurel and Hardy back and forth o=
f Rattrap and Straight SHot, Wheelie just laughed, "And you bring up Ratche=
t?  Well he's dead.  MEgatron blew off his head.  And you seem to want Rodi=
mus to end the same way.  So I shall now not leave my friend astray."<br>
<=
br>
And without a further word, Wheelie transformed to his vehicle mode, an=
d raced off!<br>
<br>
OOC - This is how I see the character - at this point=
, he thinks it's utter nonsense to waste time looking for a Space Bridge th=
at there's no evidence of or anything remotely suggesting, based upon Tusco=
n having a 'hunch' so he's going insubordinate and off on his own.  TO him,=
 a Space Bridge would e impossible to hdie (a la the third Transformers mov=
ie Dark of the Moon), and so wasting time scanning for it is a fool's erran=
d.  So he's going off to 'look' for Rodimus on his own, unless stopped or o=
therwis einterfered with as he's afraid that Tuscon is purposefully stallin=
g to prevent them from going after Rodimus.  He respects Leo Prime, but he'=
s friends with Rorimus, and he has a very low regard for Tuscon, and at thi=
s point in his processor Tuscon deciding to check for something to him that=
 has infinitesimal chances of having been done and stall a gridwide search =
is abaondment of his friend.  Anyways, wondrful posting and good luck!<br>
